message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has recurrent episodes of palpitations, chest pain, shortness of breath, sweating, and dizziness accompanied by intense fear of losing control over himself. These symptoms suggest panic disorder, which is often accompanied by depression and feelings of guilt. Preoccupation with an observed flaw in physical appearance is characteristic of body dysmorphic disorder, fear of spiders and heights is characteristic of specific phobia, and disorganized speech and delusions are characteristic of schizophrenia.
